Waaaaay too overhyped for me. I was told it'd be great.
 The gameplay just wasn't fun, paticularly the upgrade and respawning system, however the plot was great and the characters likeable. 

Would make a great film but as a game it just isn't fun.

I'm not generally the emotional type when it comes to playing games, but this game nearly had me. Though most people prefer the other BioShock games, to me, this one stood out, the visuals are stunning and the gameplay is fun. But what's a game without a story to tell? That's where it got me. Near the end (I'm not going to spoil it), I nearly cried, and that's rare, it made me feel very sad inside, and I just couldn't get my mind off it for a couple of hours. The only other time a game has managed that was BioShock 2's happy ending.

So, I'm greatful they were able to do something that actually got me in the feels.

Eines der wenigen Spiele, dass mich nicht nur vom Gameplay sondern auch von der Story sehr beeidruckt hat. Bioshock Infinite sollte man gespielt haben. Und wenn man schon dabei ist gleich auch noch Bioshock 1 nachholen und dann den Season Pass zu Infinite spielen.
Uno de los mejores juegos que hay, es emocionante y atrapante. graficamente es espectacular.

Amazing, Awesome, Admirable. Triple A game. Great visuals, awesome gameplay, incredibly lovable companion character, all topped off with an amazing and thought provoking story and you've got yourself a pretty quality game! Enjoy!
Best game of the series. Also have the Xbox version. If you don't have this game get it, you won't be disappointed.

Bioshock 1 realmente marco parte importante en mi vida, lo jugue cuando estaba mal emocionalmente, y poco a poco comprendi y entendi las normas de la sociedad. Punto aparte es un gran juego con una trama realmente muy original y profunda (eso es lo que te engancha), los graficos son muy buenos, no los mejores del mercado pero con bioshock es mas que suficiente, las gama de armas se mantiene en toda la saga, adicionando algunas mas en infinite.

Bioshock Infinite marca un gran final abordando como siempre temas profundos del mundo y sociedad, es tan complejo de buena forma, y tan bien pensado que nunca vas a dejar de disfrutarlo.

En resumen Bioshock no es simplemente un juego, sino una obra maestra. Juegalo y entiendelo.

Not much to say about the story without giving anything away.

What I will say: Elizabeth is the first NPC in a game to genuinely impress me. Her movements are fluid, and her reactions are logical; it seemed like every little thing I did, she would respond to. She waits outside when you go in a bathroom, or acts disgusted at a particularly gruesome kill. Just all around, she's great. She's the first NPC to make me feel something akin to awe. And, she looks like a Disney princess to boot.

Bioshock Infinite: uma obra prima dos jogos.
O jogo possui uma história envolvente e que te prende do início ao fim. Possui pelos gráficos e todas os cenários extremamente bem trabalhados. Tudo isso com um final supreendente que é considerado um tipo de final capaz de explodir a sua mente.
Recomendo esse jogo a todos, sei se não irão se arrepender de comprar e jogar.

The game is really impressive and has a much deeper story than the two prior games. It doesn't really seem like it has anything to do with the original bioshock series and for the most part it doesn't but it does explicitly show you exactly how bioshock ties into the world of bioshock infinite towards the end of the game. Be prepared for one of the biggest twists in video game history because this one will screw with your head.

I had heard much good about Bioshock Infinite over the years but never really gave it a thought. Finally decided to just try it a little and 9 hours later caught myself absolutely stunned by the story. The game mechanics feel amazing and the game is first and foremost an FPS. However what really sets it aside from other RPGs is the incredible draw to the story.
One of the three best games in the Bioshock series.

Get this game!
Alright, you need more to go on. The gameplay is a solid shooter that is smoother and more fluid than previous Bioshocks games (which were already great). The world feels populated and relatively believable (with a range of obvious execptions). The main characters build a strong and interesting story with Booker (the player) as a hired mercenary focused on paying off a debt with this one job. And Elizabeth, the assistant and rescuee, giving a charmingly believable feminitiy while displaying a strong and respectable character. 
The story goes from general tensions to humanistic interactions. Dealing with everything from basic right and wrong to parallel universes and thermodynamics. Even after you finish the game, which has a fantastic twist, you'll want to look up all the little details that were odd at first but make a whole heck of a lot of sense later.
While it doesn't rival the movie Primer when it comes to being the best time travel movie ever, it still is worth it solely to enjoy the philosophical conflicts presented throughout the game. And if you take a moment to consider the heartbreaking reality the characters are put through, you might have trouble seeing the screen with the tears in your eyes.
